text: Davan Maharaj (born in Trinidad and Tobago) is a journalist and the former editor-in-chief and publisher of the Los Angeles Times. ==Biography== Maharaj was born in Trinidad and Tobago.http://www.pravasiherald.com/index.php/pravasih/comments/davan_maharaj_named_editor_of_la_times/ He worked as a reporter at the Trinidad Express before moving to the United States, where he received a degree in political science from the University of Tennessee, as well as a master's degree in law from Yale University. He started his career at the Los Angeles Times as an intern in 1989, subsequently working as a reporter in Los Angeles, Orange County, and East Africa. He won the 2005 Ernie Pyle Award for Human Interest Writing. Maharaj received a political science degree from University of Tennessee, and a master's degree in law from Yale University. In December 2011, Maharaj was named editor and executive vice president of the Times. In March 2016, he was named editor-in- chief and publisher. In December 2016, L.A.Magazine published an in-depth report that was a disturbing exposure of Maharaj's methods managing the Los Angeles Times.https://money.cnn.com/2016/12/07/media/los-angeles-times-davan- maharaj/ In August 2017, Ross Levinsohn and Jim Kirk, replaced Davan Maharaj as editor and publisher of the Los Angeles Times.https://www.latimes.com/business/hollywood/la-fi-ct-los-angeles- times-20170821-story.html ==References== Category:Year of birth missing (living people) Category:Living people Category:Yale Law School alumni Category:University of Tennessee alumni Category:Los Angeles Times publishers (people)
title: Davan Maharaj
